body.p:
To the Hon Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners respectfully represent, that a judgment was rendered at the November term 1860 of the Clark Circuit Court Kentucky against John A Williams for Fifty dollars on a charge of carrying concealed weapons -- We desire a remission of that Judgment and respectfully refer to the Petition presented to your Excellency last October by John A Williams and others now on file in your Department which sought a Release from the Indictment, but upon which A remission of an alleged Judgment was issued, but that was before Judgment and by its terms could not be used -- it only came to Mr Williams' possession on the day before the case was set for trial, not giving him time enough to ask your further action, the only or best course left for him was to permit Judgment to go by default, and then call your attention to it, which we now desire to do, The papers presented in October as aforesaid will be found to contain very full and satisfactory reasons to justify your interposition, and we solicit a remission of said Judgment,

Robert S. Scott
Chas Eginton
Jno B Huston
Jos T Tucker
Willis F Sphar
John H. Moore
John Catherwood
A. H. Buckner
John B Foster

Clarke Cir. Ct
$50 } Weapons
Issd Feb 5. 1861
Jno. A Williams
